Joseph Gordon-Levitt compared Arthur to the producer of Cobb's art, "the one saying, 'Okay, you have your vision; now I'm going to figure out how to make all the nuts and bolts work so you can do your thing'". This highlights the collaborative nature of their partnership.
As an extractor, Cobb's partner Arthur is necessary for his missions. Gordon-Levitt did all but one of his stunt scenes, indicating a high level of skill and proficiency in this role.
Mal is a manifestation of Cobb's guilt about the real cause of Mal's suicide. This highlights the impact of his actions on their relationship.
Cobb is unable to control these projections of Mal, challenging his abilities as an extractor. This indicates a level of unpredictability and complexity in their relationship.
Nolan described Mal as 'the essence of the femme fatale,' emphasizing her archetypal qualities.

DiCaprio praised Cotillard's performance, stating that 'she can be strong and vulnerable and hopeful and heartbreaking all in the same moment.' This highlights the nuanced portrayal of Mal by Cotillard.
